SENTENCE.STRING: (3,901 m) is a mountain in the Bernina Range in Switzerland and Italy.
main ridge, which runs from east to west.
The name Pal端 derives from the Latin palus, meaning a swamp, and
is probably named after the Alpe Pal端, a high alpine pasture some 4 km to
was first climbed, but the first ascent of the central and highest peak was probably by K. E. Digby with guide Peter Jenny and a porter in 1866.
was certainly ascended on 28 June 1868 by A. W. Moore, Horace Walker and Jakob Anderegg.
The east peak (3,882 m) was climbed by Oswald Heer, and P. and M. Flury, with guides Johann Madutz and Gian Marchet Colani (the 'King of the Bernina') on 12 August 1835.
All three peaks were first traversed by Wachler, Wallner, George, Hans Gross and Christian Gross on 22 July 1868.
has gained some prominence from the film The White Hell of Pitz Palu (1929), co-directed by mountain-film pioneer Arnold Fanck and Georg Wilhelm Pabst, and starring a young Leni Riefenstahl.
